text: Hi, I have a question with regards to reCaptcha and bot related spam-prevention: Apparently, HubSpot does not offer a really good instance to prevent bots from submitting forms. We have seen an increase in bot submissions which is obviously not what anyone wants. I read that there might be few workarounds, including creating a property field for the form where a user needs to do a simple match calculation. Another way would be using code (which is not really an option for us) and thirdly, to create a hidden field with a specific logic. This field would then only be visible for bots and not humans and once filled out by a bot, the logic would prevent the form from being submitted. If anyone knows how to create the third option, that would be immensely appreciated :)

Hello Everyone !! :wave:
I am trying to integrate HubSpot api with Angular 13.
so first , I started with OAuth2 to get the access and refresh token.
I am hitting this api :
<https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token>
with this response body:
```const formData = {
  grant_type: 'authorization_code',
  client_id: CLIENT_ID,
  client_secret: CLIENT_SECRET,
  redirect_uri: REDIRECT_URI,
  code: req.query.code
};```
But I am hitting CORS error in this API. It works fine with Postman though.
Anybody has any idea on how to solve this ? Much help needed.
